document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the subgenus Bessobates of the genus Netelia from Japan (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Tryphoninae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the subgenus Bessobates of the genus Netelia from Japan (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Tryphoninae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Netelia ( Bessobates ) frenata
Tolkanitz, 1981 a
: 38
;
Kasparyan & Tolkanitz, 1999
: 171
.

subSubSection.paragraph: ♂. Head ( Figs 19, 20 ) 1.7–1.9 times as wide as long; vertex in dorsal view evenly rounded; occiput and interocellar area impunctate and polished; vertex and gena weakly and finely punctate; geno-orbital index 3.1–3.8 ; frons impunctate and finely coriaceous, without median longitudinal groove; face 1.3–1.5 times as wide as long, sparsely though rather more strongly punctate than vertex; supraclypeal suture distinct; clypeus 2.1–2.4 times as wide as long, impunctate, with apical margin truncate and emarginate medially; antenna with 40–47 flagellomeres, 1 st flagellomere 1.4–1.6 times as long as 2 nd, 2 nd 2.4–2.8 times as long as wide.
Fore tibial spur 0.5–0.6 times as long as 1 st tarsomere, which is 8.7–9.7 times as long as wide; fore tarsal claw with 22–27 teeth; hind tarsal claw with 15–20 teeth.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 19–23. Male of
Netelia ( Bessobates ) frenata
. 19, Head in dorsal view; 20, head in frontal view; 21, mesosoma in dorsal view; 22, fore wing; 23, hind wing.

subSubSection.paragraph: Head yellow; in some specimens, occiput and interocellar area brownish-yellow; antenna reddish-yellow. Mesosoma yellow to reddish-yellow; mesoscutum with brownish-yellow to blackish-brown stripes on each of median and lateral lobes and a brownish-yellow to blackish-brown spot situated behind median stripe; in some specimens, scutellum brownish-yellow; mesopleuron with brownish-yellow to blackish-brown markings; in most specimens, mesosternum brownish-yellow to blackish-brown; in some specimens, dorsal portion of propodeum brownish-yellow. Legs brownish-yellow; hind tarsus whitish-yellow. Wings hyaline; vein C and pterostigma of fore wing yellow to brownish-yellow, other veins brown. Metasoma reddish-yellow to brown.

Distribution. Japan (Hokkaido, Honshu, Shikoku, Kyushu), Russia .

Remarks. This is the first record of
frenata
from Japan . This species resembles
latungula
in the absence of an overhang and strip of minutely papillate cuticle on the mesal surface of the paramere, the membranous pad and the presence of teeth on the ventro-apical corner of the digitus, but can be distinguished from the latter by the characters in the key.
